basic_node.title: Birefringence in object material
basic_node.description: Birefringence, referred as double refraction, resulting from the occurance of an ordinary refractive index and an additional extraordinary refractive index depending on beam polarization state and incidence angle, most common for anisotropic materials.
basic_node.references: [sp46, http://aip.scitation.org/doi/10.1063/1.1662961] [sp47, https://ieeexplore.ieee.org/document/8500511/, Mutual influence of absorption; reflection and transmission: A + R + T = 1 with absorption coefficient A; reflection coefficient R; transmission coefficient T. Thus; causes for one of these three inevitably affect the other two.] [sp47, https://linkinghub.elsevier.com/retrieve/pii/S0924271612000378, Mutual influence of absorption; reflection and transmission: A + R + T = 1 with absorption coefficient A; reflection coefficient R; transmission coefficient T.
